results.title: Emergency bridge - Hutt Gully
results.brief_description: Shows the step-by-step erection of a Bailey bridge by the Country Roads Board over a washaway on the Great Ocean Road, Victoria. In twelve hours, over 11 inches of rain had fallen, causing a gully 110 feet wide and 50 feet deep, thus completely stopping traffic. Twelve hours later traffic was flowing across a prefabricated bridge built by the Board as a temporary measure.

results.creator_credit: Ernst Matray, Rudolph Polk, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films
results.brief_description: Emanuel Feuermann, internationally known cellist, plays Dvorak’s Rondo, Opus 94, Spinning Song by Popper. He is accompanied by Theodore Saidenberg at the piano.

results.title: The Elysian bus
results.brief_description: Five people discover each other in an unknown place in a heavy fog. Through flashbacks the situation is gradually clarified: each has been involved in a fatal car accident, due, in all cases, to carelessness.

results.title: Ely Cathedral
results.brief_description: Commenced over 1,000 years ago, Ely Cathedral possesses many original features of special interest such as the beautiful Galilee Porch and the octagonal lantern. Detailed studies include ceiling paintings, the choir screen, High Altar and ancient stained glass windows.

results.title: Elp: what's to be done
results.brief_description: Deals with the problem of noisy machinery in working environments, and the belated problems of silicosis and vascular spasms which are associated with working with pneumatic tools and equipment. Swedish industry is the scene of considerable research in this field.

results.title: Elliptical orbits
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Kevin Smith and Educational Services
results.brief_description: Starting with an elliptic orbit (as of a satellite) and using Kepler’s law of areas, shows that the gravitational force on the satellite obeys an inverse square relation. The derivation is almost entirely geometric in nature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norton Bloom, Kevin Smith and Educational Services

results.title: Elizabethan stage: Henry V [study extract]
results.brief_description: The opening sequence of Olivier’s film version of “Henry V”. A remarkable recreation of Shakespeare’s London, showing the first part of the play as it may well have been produced originally on the stage of the Globe Theatre. Olivier’s treatment has been very free, and many amusing sidelights on the actors and audiences of Shakespeare’s day are included. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Robert Helpmann, Leslie Banks, Quentin Crisp.

results.title: Elizabethan express
results.creator_credit: Tony Thompson, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: From King’s Cross Station, London, to Waverley Station, Edinburgh, is 393 miles. The Elizabethan - a summertime express - does this journey in six and a half hours non-stop - the longest daily non-stop run in the world to be timed at over 60 mph in 1954. This film is about one of those runs and the people behind the service.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Thompson, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
